get.description:
The IoT function on an Access Point (AP) involves managing and facilitating communication between various IoT
devices and the network. This includes configuring and maintaining radio profiles, transport protocols, Zigbee
services, and specific systems like SES-imagotag's Electronic Shelf Label (ESL) system. Below is a brief description
of each sub-configuration:
 Radio Profile List - Defines the configuration parameters for different radio profiles used by IoT devices. This
 includes settings such as mode, transmit power, and radio types etc.
 Transport Profile List - Specifies the transport protocols and settings used for communication between IoT devices
 and the network. This includes protocols like IoTops, HPPTS, and HTTP.
 Zigbee Service Profile List - Contains the configuration details for Zigbee services, including network settings,
 device roles, and service-specific parameters.
 SES-imagotag's Electronic Shelf Label (ESL) System - Captures the configuration details specific to SES-imagotag's ESL system, including label types, update intervals, and communication settings.

post.summary: Create a new IoT profile by unique name
post.description: Global profile for IoT parameters including radio profile and transport profile.

get.description: Global profile for IoT parameters including radio profile and transport profile.

patch.description: Global profile for IoT parameters including radio profile and transport profile.

delete.description: Global profile for IoT parameters including radio profile and transport profile.

delete_object_type.name: object_type
delete_object_type.description: LOCAL - To delete local objects. SHARED - To delete shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

delete_scope_id.name: scope_id
delete_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

delete_persona.name: persona
delete_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_object_type.name: object_type
post_object_type.description: LOCAL - To create local objects. SHARED - To create shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

post_scope_id.name: scope_id
post_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_persona.name: persona
post_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_object_type.name: object_type
patch_object_type.description: LOCAL - To update local objects. SHARED - To update shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

patch_scope_id.name: scope_id
patch_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_persona.name: persona
patch_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

get_object_type.name: object_type
get_object_type.description: Retrieves LOCAL or SHARED or both(default) configuration objects.

get_scope_id.name: scope_id
get_scope_id.description: Configuration at a given scope. Mandatory for view_type = LOCAL.

get_persona.name: persona
get_persona.description: Filters configuration specific to given persona type. If not provided and view_type = LOCAL, then defaults to all persona.

effective.name: effective
effective.description: True - Returns effective configuration (i.e hierarchically merged configuration). False - Returns committed configuration at a given scope.

detailed.name: detailed
detailed.description: True - Includes annotations in the returned json to indicate the type of object, scope, and persona. False - Returns only config objects without annotations.

view_type.name: view_type
view_type.description: LIBRARY - Returns shared objects in library. For LIBRARY, all other parameters listed below, except 'detailed' , will be ignored. LOCAL - Returns configurations for a scope and one or more persona based on parameters below.

schema.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

schema.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

ArubaIot_IotSchema.description:
The IoT function on an Access Point (AP) involves managing and facilitating communication between various IoT
devices and the network. This includes configuring and maintaining radio profiles, transport protocols, Zigbee
services, and specific systems like SES-imagotag's Electronic Shelf Label (ESL) system. Below is a brief description
of each sub-configuration:
 Radio Profile List - Defines the configuration parameters for different radio profiles used by IoT devices. This
 includes settings such as mode, transmit power, and radio types etc.
 Transport Profile List - Specifies the transport protocols and settings used for communication between IoT devices
 and the network. This includes protocols like IoTops, HPPTS, and HTTP.
 Zigbee Service Profile List - Contains the configuration details for Zigbee services, including network settings,
 device roles, and service-specific parameters.
 SES-imagotag's Electronic Shelf Label (ESL) System - Captures the configuration details specific to SES-imagotag's ESL system, including label types, update intervals, and communication settings.

profile.description: Global profile for IoT parameters including radio profile and transport profile.

radio.description:
List of IoT Radio Profiles with a specific radio-name, each list entry includes BLE mode or ZIGBEE mode properties.
BLE properties includes: console mode, operation mode, transmission power in dBm, external or internal radio instance,
ZIGBEE properties includes: scanning channel, coordinator operation mode.

instance-type.description: Enables external or internal radio instance.

mode.description: Set IoT radio mode, range: BLE, ZIGBEE, BLE ZIGBEE, NONE.

firmware.description: IoT radio firmware type, DEFAULT or SDR

ble-console.description:
Set BLE console mode. Configure one of the following:
dynamic: The built-in BLE chip of the Instant AP functions in the beaconing mode and dynamically enables access
to Instant AP console over BLE when the link to the LMS is lost. The dynamic console mode performs special error
checks when the Instant AP experiences connectivity issues and decides if the BLE Console needs to be enabled.
off: Disables the BLE console.
on: Enables the BLE console.

ble-opmode.description:
Set BLE operational mode. Configure one of the following:
beaconing: The built-in BLE chip of the Instant AP functions as an iBeacon combined with the beacon management functionality.
scanning: Enables BLE scanning on the Instant AP.
both: Enables both BLE beaconing and scanning options.

ble-txpower.description: Set BLE transmit power in dBm (knob not applicable for 3xx APs except 303P).

zigbee-channel.description: Set Zigbee channel to 11-26 or auto.

radio-iot-zone.description:
Denotes the zone names for the IoT radio profile. When a zone is defined in the radio profile and the same
zone name is defined on an AP, the radio profile is created on that AP. You can enter multiple zone names as
comma-separated values.

items.description:
Configures the BLE beacon profile reference within a radio profile.
This configuration is applicable when the radio mode is set to BLE or both BLE and Zigbee.

antenna-gain.description: Configures an antenna gain value for Instant APs with external antennas. Range: -63.9 to 63.9.

iot-zone.description:
This command enables the zone configured for an IoT transport profile or radio profile. When a zone is defined in the
transport profile or radio profile and the same zone name is defined on an AP, the transport profile or radio profile
is created on that AP. This allows different IoT transport or radio profiles to work in different zones.

ANY.description: Any of local or shared config object.

ZIGBEE properties includes: scanning channel, coordinator operation mode.

both: Enables both BLE beaconing and scanning options.

ble-txpower.description: Set BLE transmit power in dBm (knob not applicable for 3xx APs except 303P).

zigbee-channel.description: Set Zigbee channel to 11-26 or auto.

This configuration is applicable when the radio mode is set to BLE or both BLE and Zigbee.

antenna-gain.description: Configures an antenna gain value for Instant APs with external antennas. Range: -63.9 to 63.9.

This command enables the zone configured for an IoT transport profile or radio profile. When a zone is defined in the
